interventions.name: Extended Individual Counseling - Relapse Prevention Model

summary: The research is based on a chronic disorder model of cigarette smoking which suggests that long-term treatment targeted to prevent relapse may be useful. Based on this model, the investigators have developed a relapse prevention treatment to intervene on five areas important in relapse prevention, including fluctuating motivation, depression, withdrawal, weight gain, and social support. This treatment protocol has produced high long-term abstinence rates when implemented in a clinical research setting. The current study will evaluate the treatment model when implemented in a medical outpatient setting.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reported 7-day Point Prevalence Abstinence at Week 12
